intro: Stephanophorum infundibuliformis, commonly known as the broad-leaved stephanophorum, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its large, broad leaves and showy, clustered inflorescences. The plant produces yellow flowers that are often surrounded by modified leaves called bracts. It thrives in well-drained soils and is typically found in coastal and montane regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
